chicago.neighborhoods: The Loop, River North, Lincoln Park, Wicker Park, Hyde Park, Near North Side, South Loop
chicago.meetingHighlights: One of the nation's largest AA communities with meetings in every neighborhood, many specialty meetings, and 24-hour resources for newcomers.
chicago.transitInfo: CTA trains and buses cover the metro; O'Hare (ORD) and Midway (MDW) airports provide national and international travel.

joliet.meetingHighlights: Community meetings with a mix of open and closed groups; several evening and weekend speaker meetings.
joliet.transitInfo: Pace suburban buses and Metra commuter rail to Chicago; regional highways provide car access.

naperville.meetingHighlights: Suburban meetings with strong lunchtime and evening attendance for commuters; active service structure and newcomer-friendly groups.
naperville.transitInfo: Metra commuter rail to Chicago and Pace buses; proximity to I-88 for regional driving.

peoria.meetingHighlights: Active downtown and neighborhood meetings with a range of formats including Big Book and step-study groups.
peoria.transitInfo: CityLink buses serve Peoria and surrounding towns; General Wayne A. Downing Peoria International Airport for regional flights.

rockford.meetingHighlights: Neighborhood-centered meetings with steady attendance and regular speaker nights in the downtown area.
rockford.transitInfo: CityLine buses and regional routes; Chicago Rockford International Airport for regional travel.

aurora.neighborhoods: Downtown Aurora, Aurora East, Aurora West, Fox Valley
aurora.meetingHighlights: Diverse suburban meetings with active community groups and regular speaker events serving the Fox Valley.
aurora.transitInfo: Metra commuter rail to Chicago and Pace buses; good highway access to I-88 and I-355.

evanston.neighborhoods: Downtown Evanston, Central Street, Sheridan Road, South Evanston
evanston.meetingHighlights: Active university-area meetings due to Northwestern University and a strong downtown meeting schedule; many lunchtime and evening options.
evanston.transitInfo: CTA and Metra services provide connections to Chicago; local buses serve neighborhood routes.

springfield.neighborhoods: Downtown, Historic District, East Springfield, Berry
springfield.meetingHighlights: Active capital-city meetings with a steady weekday and evening schedule and several faith-based groups.
springfield.transitInfo: SMTD buses serve Springfield; Abraham Lincoln Capital Airport (SPI) for regional flights.
